SENT.plain: A 28-year-old Marfan's syndrome woman was referred to our hospital because of sudden chest and back pain
She had received replacement of the descending and ascending aorta for acute aortic dissection previously in other two institutions
CT scan revealed the massive mediastinal hematoma and hemothorax which suggested ruptured dissecting aneurysm of the transverse arch
Emergent total arch replacement, re-ascending replacement and aortic root plasty successfully weve performed
She recovered uneventfully although she had residual thoracoabdominal dissecting aneurysm
It was suggested that total arch replacement should be performed for Stanford A type dissection in Marfan's syndrome
